description.@en: An ancient spell, this has been used to preserve many musty tomes, including my own . . .

effect.@en: After successfully casting, one inanimate object is perfectly preserved, unable to be destroyed by normal means. This means it is proofed against fire, heat, rain and other natural elements the Historian feels it should appropriately be immune to. It also cannot be destroyed by normal means. If the target object is a weapon, it is now treated as if it were Superior in Grade.

criticalSuccess.@en: You can cast Preservation on three objects instead.

criticalFailure.@en: The inanimate object immediately crumbles to dust.

reagents.@en: Any inanimate object smaller than a child, such as a grimoire, piece of clothing or scrap of wood
